content:
The Chicago Bulls' roster during their championship season in 1998 included several key players, such as:

1. Michael Jordan (Shooting Guard)
2. Scottie Pippen (Small Forward)
3. Dennis Rodman (Power Forward)
4. Ron Harper (Point Guard/Shooting Guard)
5. Steve Kerr (Point Guard/Shooting Guard)
6. Toni Kukoč (Small Forward/Power Forward)

Jordan, Pippen, and Rodman were the team's top performers, with Jordan and Pippen both making the All-NBA First Team and Rodman being named the league's Defensive Player of the Year. The team also had a strong supporting cast, with players like Harper, Kerr, and Kukoč contributing important minutes and clutch performances throughout the season and playoffs. Their incredible teamwork and talent under the leadership of coach Phil Jackson helped them win their sixth championship in eight years.
